titles.title: Fraud Accountability and Recovery Act
Fraud Accountability and Recovery Act

To amend the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 to prohibit the President from providing assistance to the government of any country that has failed to extradite an individual that has been convicted of committing fraud against the United States or that has failed to take all appropriate measures with respect to assisting the recoupment of those funds.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
